items.title: Foroglio | Switzerland Waterfall | One of the Most Beautiful Traditional Villages in Ticino
items.description:
Foroglio is a beautiful waterfall in Switzerland, located more specifically in the village of Foroglio, in the Maggia Valley, canton of Ticino. The village is part of the municipality of Cevio and is known for its traditional stone houses, many of which have slate roofs, adding to the picturesque and authentic Swiss Alpine atmosphere.

📍 Foroglio, Switzerland 

The Foroglio waterfall is known for its picturesque setting, surrounded by lush greenery and the natural beauty of the Swiss Pre Alps. 
The Foroglio waterfall is fed by the Maggia River and plunges down a rocky cliff, creating a stunning and serene atmosphere. 
Visitors often appreciate the tranquility of the area and the opportunity to enjoy nature.

items.title: Sabbione - Switzerland | Epic Cinematic Video | Real Life Hobbit Village | Switzerland at its Best
items.description:
Sabbione is a small village located in the upper part of the Maggia Valley, and it is known for its picturesque location surrounded by mountains and forests, and also for being a real life hobbit village, because it seems to have come straight out of Tolkien tales. The banks of the Maggia River are known for their crystal-clear waters and is popular for swimming, kayaking, and other water sports.

The Church of Santa Maria degli Angeli is also a significant attraction in the area. The church features beautiful frescoes and paintings, and it is a popular destination for visitors interested in art and history. The surrounding area of Sabbione is also well-known for its natural beauty, and there are numerous hiking and biking trails in the nearby mountains and forests. It is a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts and features stunning scenery, including waterfalls, alpine meadows, and rugged peaks.

In addition to outdoor activities, Sabbione and the surrounding area offer a range of cultural and culinary experiences. The local cuisine features regional specialties such as polenta, risotto, and goat cheese, and there are several restaurants in the area that serve traditional Ticinese dishes. Overall, Sabbione is a charming village in the Maggia Valley of Ticino, Switzerland, that offers visitors a range of cultural and outdoor experiences. Whether you're interested in art, history, nature, or cuisine, Sabbione and the surrounding area are sure to offer something to suit your interests.


📍 Sabbione, Ticino, Switzerland

title: Lugano Region - by Wonders of Switzerland

items.title: Swissminiatur | Amazing journey throughout Switzerland | Family-friendly attraction in Lugano Region
items.description:
Today, we bring you with us to Melide, a small city in the Lugano Region, to the miniature museum called Swissminiatur, featuring Switzerland in miniature, for great emotions.
The miniatures they feature here represent the most significative places in Switzerland.
Swissminiatur is Switzerland’s largest open-air miniature museum.
On the shores of Lake Lugano, the park is surrounded by majestic mountains including Monte Generoso, San Salvatore and also San Giorgio, which has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Home to 129 models of Switzerland’s most famous buildings, monuments and means of transport in the unusual 1.25 scale. The miniatures on display include meticulously faithful reproductions of Rapperswil Castle, Chillon Castle and the Castles of Bellinzona, the Parliament Building in Bern and the Piazza Grande in Locarno.

Immerse yourself in the world of Swiss railway history in miniature: a 3,560 m miniature railway network winds its way around the park, with eighteen trains running on the tracks. Admire the funicular railways and cableways that travel up and down the mountains, the boats that plough through the lakes and the cars speeding along the motorway. See the planes getting ready to take off from Zurich-Kloten airport!

Traditional methods and innovative processes have been combined to create some real masterpieces in miniature. Appreciate the painstaking handiwork, which stays true to the original and is carried out with great passion.

Swissminiatur park opened in 1959 and visits here are recalled with great fondness by young and old alike. This is an amazing adventure. So, come with us and discover all the most amazing sites in Switzerland all in the same place.

📍 Melide - Lugano, Switzerland

🎶  Music by Epidemicsound

#switzerland  #travel  #travelgoals

items.title: Valle di Muggio in Switzerland | Discovering the Charm of a Typical Prealpine Valley in Ticino
items.description:
Welcome to our adventure in the stunning valley of Muggio, located in the heart of Ticino, Switzerland. In this video, we take you on a breathtaking journey through this magical destination, showcasing its three main attractions - the charming Muggio village, the picturesque Muggio valley, and the historic Bruzella mill.

Our journey begins in the quaint village of Muggio, where we explore the narrow streets and alleys, adorned with traditional stone houses and blooming flowers. As we wander through the village, we discover the unique character and rich cultural heritage that make Muggio such a special place.

Next, we venture into the breathtaking Muggio valley, surrounded by rolling hills and dense forests. We hike along the scenic trails, admiring the stunning views of the surrounding landscapes and the crystal-clear waters of the river running through the valley.

Finally, we visit the Bruzella mill, an ancient water-powered mill that has been in operation for over 400 years. We learn about its fascinating history and witness the traditional techniques used to grind grain and produce flour, which is still used today to make delicious local bread and pastries.

Join us on this unforgettable journey to Muggio valley, as we discover the hidden treasures of this beautiful region and experience the authentic Swiss culture and traditions that make it truly unique.

📍 La Valle di Muggio, Ticino, Switzerland
🎶 Music by Epidemicsound

items.title: You won't believe how deep it is ! 1 Day in Lake Como, Italy | Among the Most Famous Lakes in Europe
items.description:
Como is a city at the southern tip of Lake Como in northern Italy, very close to the border with Switzerland. It's known for the Gothic Como Cathedral, a scenic funicular railway, and a waterfront promenade. The Museo Didattico della Seta traces the history of Como's silk industry, while the Tempio Voltiano museum is dedicated to Italian physicist Alessandro Volta. Just north are the lakeside gardens of the palatial Villa Olmo, as well as other stately villas. 

In this video, we share our adventure in Como and offer some itinerary ideas. If you will spend 1 day in Como and want to follow our itinerary, here are some useful links:

items.title: Pisa - Italy: Piazza dei Miracoli - 4K
items.description:
#pisa #italy #leaningtower #piazzadeimiracoli

The city of Pisa is a city and comune in Tuscany, central Italy.
It is the capital city of the Province of Pisa. Although Pisa is known worldwide for its leaning tower, the city contains more than twenty other historic churches, several medieval palaces, and bridges across the Arno river.
Much of the city's architecture was financed from its history as one of the Italian maritime republics.

The Piazza dei Miracoli (Italian; English: Square of Miracles), formally known as Piazza del Duomo (English: Cathedral Square), is recognised as an important centre of European medieval art and one of the finest architectural complexes in the world. 
Considered sacred by the Catholic Church, its owner, the square is dominated by four great religious edifices: the Pisa Cathedral, the Pisa Baptistry, the Campanile, and the Camposanto Monumentale (Monumental Cemetery). 
Partly paved and partly grassed, the Piazza dei Miracoli is also the site of the Ospedale Nuovo di Santo Spirito (New Hospital of the Holy Spirit), which houses the Sinopias Museum (Italian: Museo delle Sinopie) and the Cathedral Museum (Italian: Museo dell'Opera del Duomo).

items.title: Rome - Colosseum & Roman Forum 2022 4K HDR
items.description:
#rome #italy #colosseum #romanforum 

The Colosseum; Italian: Colosseo; is an oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy, just east of the Roman Forum. It is the largest ancient amphitheatre ever built, and is still the largest standing amphitheatre in the world today.

The Colosseum is built of travertine limestone, tuff (volcanic rock), and brick-faced concrete. It could hold an estimated 50,000 to 80,000 spectators at various points in its history, having an average audience of some 65,000; It was used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles including animal hunts, executions, re-enactments of famous battles, and dramas based on Roman mythology, and briefly mock sea battles. 

The building ceased to be used for entertainment in the early medieval era.The Roman Forum, also known by its Latin name Forum Romanum (Italian: Foro Romano), is a rectangular forum (plaza) surrounded by the ruins of several important ancient government buildings at the center of the city of Rome. Citizens of the ancient city referred to this space, originally a marketplace, as the Forum Magnum, or simply the Forum.

items.title: London - Queen Elizabeth’s Home - 1 Day Tour - 4K HDR
items.description:
Follow us on another amazing tour through the Wonders of the World. This time: LONDON !! 🇬🇧 🇬🇧 🇬🇧


London is the capital and largest city of England and the United Kingdom, with a population of just over 9 million. It stands on the River Thames in south-east England at the head of a 50-mile (80 km) estuary down to the North Sea, and has been a major settlement for two millennia. The City of London, its ancient core and financial center, was founded by the Romans as Londinium and retains boundaries close to its medieval ones.


As one of the world's major global cities, London exerts a strong influence on its arts, entertainment, fashion, commerce and finance, education, health care, media, science and technology, tourism, and transport and communications.


London's diverse cultures encompass over 300 languages. The London metropolitan area is third-most populous in Europe after Istanbul's and Moscow's, with about 14 million inhabitants in 2016, granting London the status of a megacity.


London has four World Heritage Sites: the Tower of London; Kew Gardens; the combined Palace of Westminster, Westminster Abbey, and St Margaret's Church; and also the historic settlement in Greenwich, where the Royal Observatory, Greenwich defines the Prime Meridian (0° longitude) and Greenwich Mean Time. Other landmarks include Buckingham Palace, the London Eye, Piccadilly Circus, St Paul's Cathedral, Tower Bridge, and Trafalgar Square.

items.title: Foroglio | Switzerland Waterfall | One of the Most Beautiful Traditional Villages in Ticino
items.description:
Foroglio is a beautiful waterfall in Switzerland, located more specifically in the village of Foroglio, in the Maggia Valley, canton of Ticino. The village is part of the municipality of Cevio and is known for its traditional stone houses, many of which have slate roofs, adding to the picturesque and authentic Swiss Alpine atmosphere.

📍 Foroglio, Switzerland 

The Foroglio waterfall is known for its picturesque setting, surrounded by lush greenery and the natural beauty of the Swiss Pre Alps. 
The Foroglio waterfall is fed by the Maggia River and plunges down a rocky cliff, creating a stunning and serene atmosphere. 
Visitors often appreciate the tranquility of the area and the opportunity to enjoy nature.

items.title: Lauterbrunnen Switzerland | Most beautiful place in Switzerland
items.description:
🇨🇭 Welcome to the fairy tale village of Lauterbrunnen Switzerland! Arguably the most beautiful place in Switzerland. 

🏔️ Brace yourself for an amazing journey through this picturesque Swiss wonderland, where breathtaking landscapes meet heart-pounding activities.

🏞️ Alpine Marvels: Explore the iconic Lauterbrunnen Valley, adorned with majestic cliffs and over 70 cascading waterfalls, offering unparalleled panoramic views that inspired Tolkien himself.

🚠 Trümmelbach Falls Adventure: Venture inside the mountain to witness the raw power of Trümmelbach Falls, a series of ten cascading waterfalls within the rock. It's a sensory spectacle that immerses you in the heart of nature's forces.

🪂 Skydiving Spectacle: Join us as we witness fearless skydivers take the plunge from towering rock faces, creating a mesmerizing dance in the sky. Catch the adrenaline rush and awe-inspiring scenes that make Lauterbrunnen a magnet for thrill-seekers.

🌄 Journey to Wengen: Embark on a scenic train ride to Wengen. Marvel at the snow-covered peaks, vast glaciers, and the breathtaking beauty that surrounds you at over 1,000 meters. Walk with us through the car-free village of Wengen,.

🔔 Subscribe for More Adventures: Don't miss out on the excitement! Hit subscribe to stay tuned for our upcoming episodes featuring more thrilling escapades and hidden treasures from Lauterbrunnen, Switzerland. Join us as we uncover the secrets of this adventure paradise!

items.title: You won't believe the view !! Mount Pilatus - Switzerland 🇨🇭 Relaxing 4K HDR Video
items.description:
This video presents a great way to spend a day in Luzern, get to see the best view of the city by going to the top of  Mount Pilatus by cable car; and have fun in its adventure park, which includes an almost 2.500 ft toboggan run.

Mount Pilatus, is a mountain massif overlooking Lucerne in Central Switzerland. It is composed of several peaks, of which the highest (2,128.5 m (6,983 ft)) is named Tomlishorn.
The top can also be reached with the Pilatus Railway, the world's steepest cogwheel railway, from Alpnachstad, operating from May to November (depending on snow conditions) and the whole year with the aerial panorama gondolas and aerial cableways from Kriens. Tomlishorn is located about 1.3 km (0.81 mi) to the southeast of the top cable car and cog railway station. Two other peaks, closer to the stations are called Esel (Donkey, 2,118 m [6,949 ft]), which lies just east over the railway station, the one on the west side is called Oberhaupt (Head-Leader, 2,105 m [6,906 ft]).

♬ Music by Epidemic Sound

#switzerland  #relaxing  #mountains  #luzern  #pilatus #travel #4k

items.title: Foroglio Waterfall - Switzerland - Relaxing 4K HDR Video
items.description:
#switzerland #schweiz #swiss #suisse #switzerlandwonderland #visitswitzerland #foroglio #waterfall #water #valbavona #maggiavalley #myswitzerland #inlovewithswitzerland #switzerland_vacations #swissxplorers #lifeofswitzerland #swissalps #amazingswitzerland #switzerlandpictures #switzerland_destinations #svizzera #exploreswitzerland #iloveswitzerland #alpen #suica #suiza #schweizeralpenclub

Ticino is rich in waterfalls. The most spectacular one is the Foroglio in the Bavona Valley, at the top of the Maggia Valley. The water plummets vociferously from a height of 110 meters through foam and splashes in a striking natural scenery. Nearby, a very charming village with houses gathered around a little church, reminding us of the life of past generations who practiced transhumance and lived in the Bavona Valley only from spring to autumn.

items.title: Balcone d'Italia - Switzerland/Italy - Relaxing 4K Video
items.description:
#switzerland #schweiz #swiss #suisse #switzerlandwonderland #visitswitzerland #balconeditalia #italy #italia #myswitzerland #inlovewithswitzerland #switzerland_vacations #swissxplorers #lifeofswitzerland #swissalps #amazingswitzerland #switzerlandpictures #switzerland_destinations #svizzera #exploreswitzerland #iloveswitzerland #alpen #suica #suiza #schweizeralpenclub #travel #traveling #relaxing #relax 

Sitting 1300 meters above Lake Lugano, the “Balcony of Italy” or Monte Sighignola, once a dirt road used in WW1, is right on border's edge between Italy and Switzerland.  On a beautiful clear day, the view from the top is absolutely breathtaking, as you'll can take in the snowcapped Alps, Lake Maggiore and Lake Varese.  This is a challenging but rewarding climb to the top from Lake Como and Val d’Intelvi, with a peaceful descent, returning through Valmara and Lake Lugano.

--
Audio by Youtube's Audio Library

items.title: Switzerland 🇨🇭 Relaxing Video | Parco Della Breggia | A trip back in time
items.description:
The Parco delle Gola della Breggia is located in the Mendrisiotto region, along the river Breggia, in the lower part of the Valle di Muggio in Ticino, Switzerland. 
The natural landscape is exceptionally interesting, especially for its geological and paleontological patrimony: the rocks that appear on the surface are hundreds of millions years old. It makes this Park one of the most important geological sites in Switzerland. This place is also a treasure of biodiversity, and a silent witness to the local economic and industrial history.

items.title: Stäuber Falls (or Stäubifall) – One of the most beautiful and unknown waterfalls of Switzerland
items.description:
The Stäubifall waterfall is a beautiful natural attraction located in the Canton of Uri, in central Switzerland. The waterfall has a height of around 90 meters (295 feet) and is known for its picturesque setting and the scenic hike that leads up to it.

The hike to the Stäubifall waterfall is about 2.5 kilometers long and takes approximately 45 minutes to complete. The trail is well-marked and offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys.

The waterfall itself is a nice spot for photography, as it cascades down a rocky cliff face surrounded by lush greenery. 

Overall, the Stäubifall waterfall is a must-visit attraction for nature lovers and hikers in Switzerland, offering a beautiful natural setting and a memorable experience for visitors.

📍 Stäuber Falls, 6465 Unterschächen, Switzerland 

🎶 Music by Epidemicsound

items.title: You won't believe this view !! Lake Luzern - Switzerland 🇨🇭😍
items.description:
Lucerne is known as the pocket-sized version of Switzerland. History, culture and of course, spectacular scenery come together in a perfect blend that’ll have you longing to extend your stay.

Lake Lucerne, Switzerland’s fourth largest lake is one not to be missed. Its setting is simply stunning, with the tops of the nearby mountains glistening all year round and the lake’s fjord-like offshoots giving a more Scandinavian feel than Swiss. You can take it all in from one of the historic paddle-boats that ply the lake, or tour the water’s edge on foot.

items.description:
The Monte Tamaro lies in the triangle between Lugano, Bellinzona and Locarno. It is famous for the Santa Maria degli Angeli church designed by Mario Botta and the scenic ridge walk from Monte Lema.
Altitude: 1,962 metres
How to get there: Train from Lugano or Bellinzona to Rivera-Bironico, 15-minute walk to the valley station, two-stage cable car to Alpe Foppa (1,530 metres)
Views: To the north across the Magadino plain to Bellinzona, the Ticino mountains to the Gotthard region and the Bernese Oberland; to the south-east the Dent della Vecchia and Monte Generoso 

#switzerland #ticino #lugano #montetamaro #mountains #reflexes  #lake

items.title: How many do you count ??  🪂 🇨🇭
items.description:
Take off on a paraglider from Alpe Foppa on Monte Tamaro. The flight over the Vedeggio valley has a magnificent 360-degree view ranging from Pizzo Vogorno to Camoghé, Monte Bar and the Denti della Vecchia.

At Monte Tamaro, you can take off on your own with your paraglider or organise a tandem flight with professional pilots.

Would you like to experience the thrill of flying, feel the air currents and see breathtaking views from above? Then tandem flying is perfect! Installed in a light harness, together with professional pilots, you can enjoy this magnificent experience.

Find prices here: https://www.montetamaro.ch/en/adventure/paragliding/

#switzerland  #paragliding #mountains #swissview #montetamaro

items.title: Wait for the goats !  🐐 😂 🇨🇭
items.description:
These are some awesome shots of our hiking to the top of Mount Tamaro. 
This hike to the Monte Tamaro peak is a nice challenge with the great reward of panorama views across the Ticino region. Unlike other mountains where the cable car takes you right to top, the Tamaro cable car only takes you half-way up and you have to earn the rest of your views. This 9km loop has steep climbs but also beautiful traverses around mountains and down grassy slopes.

items.title: Swiss landscapes 🇨🇭
items.description:
This small landlocked country in central Europe also known as the land of Swiss Alps fascinates with its unique and diverse beauty even the most demanding client. In this small area (the north-south distance is 220km and the east-west distance 346km) you will find a magnificent variety of sceneries convenient to all type of preferences. Whether you like mountains and hills, lakes, rivers and glaciers, dreamy villages and well preserved medieval cities. Altogether, they compose unforgettable charm of this wonderful country.

items.title: Lake Lucerne 🇨🇭 ⛴  ⛰
items.description:
A cruising on Lake Lucerne spans grandiose natural scenery!
The wonderful Alpine landscapes of Central Switzerland form the scenic  backdrop to Lake Lucerne. Such world famous peaks as Mount Rigi, Mount Pilatus and the Stanserhorn frame the water and add scenic grandeur. Gently gliding over the water is one of the most relaxing and tranquil ways to experience the heart of the Swiss Alps. Aside from its unique shape, with countless different bays and side arms, Lake Lucerne is also noteworthy for the variety of scenery. From urban and medieval Lucerne, to the dramatic cliffs of Lake Uri along the Gotthard route, there’s much to see.

#suica #suíça #lagos #lago #lucerna #vídeodomomento

items.title: Zermatt - Switzerland 🇨🇭
items.description:
Zermatt, in southern Switzerland’s Valais canton, is a mountain resort renowned for skiing, climbing and hiking. The town, at an elevation of around 1,600m, lies below the iconic, pyramid-shaped Matterhorn peak. Its main street, Bahnhofstrasse is lined with boutique shops, hotels and restaurants, and also has a lively après-ski scene.

items.title: Swiss miniature 🇨🇭
items.description:
Swissminiatur is Switzerland’s largest open-air miniature museum.
Located in Melide, on the shores of Lake Lugano, the park is surrounded by majestic mountains including Monte Generoso, San Salvatore and also San Giorgio, which has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Relax and unwind in a tranquil natural setting.

items.title: Jesuitenkirche - Jesuit Church - Lucerne - Switzerland 🇨🇭
items.description:
The Lucerne Jesuit Church is a Catholic church in Lucerne, Switzerland. It is the first large Baroque church built in Switzerland north of the Alps. The Jesuit order, founded by Ignatius of Loyola in 1534, were active participants in the Counter-Reformation, the Catholic fight against the birth of Protestantism.

#lucerne #switzerland #suica #suisse #schweiz #shorts #church #history

items.title: St. Moritz - Switzerland 🇨🇭
items.description:
St. Moritz is a luxury alpine resort town in Switzerland’s Engadin valley. It has hosted the Winter Olympics twice, has the Cresta Run, a world-championship bobsled run made of natural ice, and an outdoor Olympic ice rink. Its frozen lake hosts polo, cricket and even horse racing on ice. Ski and snowboard areas include Corviglia, Diavolezza and Corvatsch, and there are well-groomed cross-country ski trails.

Elevation: 1,822 m
Area: 28.69 km²
Weather: 11°C, Wind S at 18 km/h, 67% Humidity weather.com
Population: 5,233 (Dec 2014)

#stmoritz  #switzerland #shorts #frozenlake #travel #schweiz #swiss

items.title: A piece of haven - Interlaken - Swiss Alps🇨🇭
items.description:
Swiss alps as seen from Interlaken, Switzerland. 🇨🇭 
Interlaken is a traditional resort town in the mountainous Bernese Oberland region of central Switzerland. Built on a narrow stretch of valley, between the emerald-colored waters of Lake Thun and Lake Brienz, it has old timber houses and parkland on either side of the Aare River. Its surrounding mountains, with dense forests, alpine meadows and glaciers, has numerous hiking and skiing trails.
Interlaken is literally a piece of heaven on earth.
